data.title: Clock problem
data.statement:
John tries to build a display for an electronic clock, in which each digit is presented using seven-segment display. 
Time is diplayed in 24-hour format HH:MM. 
Digits from 0 to 9 look like this:
`  _     _  _       _   _   _   _   _
 | | |  _| _| |_| |_  |_    | |_| |_|
 |_| | |_  _|   |  _| |_|   | |_|  _|`
When the time on the clock changes by one minute, some segments must stay turned on, some must stay turned off, and some of them have to change state.
Help John and write for him program that calculate how many segments will change state, when time changes one minute from specified time.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read time:word(5)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of cases.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Time in format [[HH:MM]]
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines with one integer:>> number of segments changing state on the display when specified time is changing one minute ahead.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

John tries to build a display for an electronic clock, in which each digit is presented using seven-segment display.
Time is diplayed in 24-hour format HH:MM.
Digits from 0 to 9 look like this:
  _     _  _       _   _   _   _   _
 | | |  _| _| |_| |_  |_    | |_| |_|
 |_| | |_  _|   |  _| |_|   | |_|  _|

When the time on the clock changes by one minute, some segments must stay turned on, some must stay turned off, and some of them have to change state.
Help John and write for him program that calculate how many segments will change state, when time changes one minute from specified time.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of cases.
Next N lines: Time in format HH:MM
Output
N lines with one integer: number of segments changing state on the display when specified time is changing one minute ahead.
Constraints
00 ≤ HH ≤ 23
00 ≤ MM ≤ 59
Example
Input
3
12:34
15:10
01:58
Output
3
4
1
